item_category: Experience the power to be your creative best. Say hello to moto g8 power. With its 5000 mAh battery, you can go up to three full days on a single charge and do the things you want without worrying about recharging. Shoot photos from close up, far away, or anywhere in between with an AI-powered quad camera system. And thanks to the 6.4inch Max Vision Full HD+ display and dual stereo speakers tuned by Dolby, you'll have an all-access pass to the world of entertainment. New moto g8 power. Unplug. Unleash.

This is the second Motorola smartphone I've had. I accidentally smashed my last one (my fault) but was happy to buy another moto phone. This is a new and improved model. The battery life on these is really good, and the screen is bright and large enough to make it comfortable to use. It's pretty much standard Android pre-installed without loads of manufacturer's apps that I don't want anyway. I've successfully installed all my regular apps, and got it set up quickly. The camera seems pretty good - you may get better on more expensive phones, but this does produce nice sharp images, and has a great macro mode for really close up. It's got a healthy 64GB of storage which can be expanded by adding a memory card. I like the graded blue colour of the case too. Altogether I'm very happy with this purchase.

My old phone kept shutting down and wasn't working to good after a couple of years. Hated the thoughts of getting a new one and trying to figure out how to work it. However I needn't have worried. It was really simple to transfer all my 'stuff' and just followed the instructions on screen. I love my new phone and got a lovely case off ebay for it. The camera takes great pictures and I use it a lot with my family when we're out and about. There's plenty of storage which was a problem with my last one. I can listen to music and its clear. Basically it does everything I need it to do. Oh and can use it as a satnav also! Would highly recommend it. It is slightly larger and that took a bit of getting used to when making a call, as its also a bit heavier than I was used to. But all in all great for the price. Very pleased.

My previous phone had water damage so needed a new phone quick,  I have had Motorola g phone before in fact the the last 3 in the series.  It may be the price I don't but but this is a step down from previous models.  The camera quality is terrible.  Even in daylight the photos come out dark and need editing,  The camera is extremely laggy, it takes forever to take the shot and the pictures are not crisp and clear you have to edit every single photo.  The speaker is at the back of the phone so if you lay phone flat like most people do it muffles the sound.  The whole design of this phone feels off.  I needed as an emergency so will keep it because of the price, but really not pleased with.  Its a very basic starter phone at best.
